oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-page handwritten letter from Ammons to his family telling of his assignment to the 1st Infantry Division in Company A, 1st Battalion, 16th Infantry. He describes sewing on his division patch and the stripes that represent his PFC E-3 rank. He relates to his family that his processing at the 1st Infantry Replacement Detachment sixteen miles northeast of Saigon is almost complete, and he will soon be joining his unit.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1st Infantry Division, the oldest division in the United States Army, is referred to as "The Big Red One"--an allusion to the graphic on the shoulder patch; it is also known as "The Fighting First." The 1st Infantry Division was the first divisional unit to fight in Vietnam and sustained 6,146 killed in action during the conflict.
